_header: What weens King Edward with his long shanks
Note: Found in many chronicles and in most MSS of the prose Brut. Cf. 4372.
Subjects: Edward I; chronicles, verse in; Scots, insults by, against the English
_description: Scots’ abuse of Edward I at Berwick — five lines

BodRawB171.Transcription:
Wenes kyng Edward wiþ his longe shankesforto wyn berwik al oure
                    vnþankesgas pikes himand when he haþ hit gas diche
                    him

CULLl214.Transcription:
Wende kynge Edwarde with his longe shankesto haue goten Berwike alle
                    oure vnthankesgas pikes hymand when he hath goten hit gas dikes
                    hym
CULLl214.Note:
In the prose Brut, rubric as heading, written as
                    prose.

BLAdd12030.Transcription: Wende kyng Edwarde with his longe shankesTo haue gete Berwyk alle oure vnthankesGas Pyke hymand after gase dyke hym
BLAdd12030.Note: Written in verse lines, not rubric.

BLAdd24859.Transcription: Wende kyng Edwarde with his longe shankesTo haue gete Berwyk alle oure vnthankesGas Pyke hymand after gase dyke hym

BLEge650.Transcription: Wende kyng Edward with þi long shankysto gete berwyke oure vnthankysgas pykes hymAnd whenne he hase it gas dykes hym

BLHar24.Transcription: wende kyng Edwarde with his longe shankesTo haue gete Berwike alle oure vnthankesfirste Gas pyke hym and after that gase dyke hym
BLHar24.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library Harley MS 24.
         https://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?ref=Harley_MS_24.

BLHar53.Transcription: What wende þe kyng Edward with his long shankesffor till haue wonne Berewik all oure vnthankesPykes hyme and when he has it gas dikes hym

BLHar266.Transcription: Wend king Edewarde wiþ his lange shankesTo haue gete Berwyke al our vnþankesGas pikes hymand whenne has gas dikes hym…

BLHar753.Transcription: Wende kyng Edward with þe longe shankeshaue gete Berwyk all our þankesgas pykys hymAnd whan he had do gas dikys hym

BLHar1337.Transcription: Went kynge Edward with his longe shankisTo have goten Berewik al aȝenst our thankisGas piken hym & aftir Gas diken hym
BLHar1337.Note: Written as prose, only four lines in this witness.

BLHar1568.Transcription: Wende kyng Edwarde with his long schankesffor to wyne Barwike att oure vnthankesGas pikes himAnd whene he hath gas diches hym

BLHar2182.Transcription: Wende kyng Edward with his longe schankishaue gete Berwik alle oure vnþankisGas likis him& whanne he haþ it gas dikes him

BLHar2256.Transcription: Wende þu Edward with þy longe schankisto haue gote Berewik all oure biþankisgas pikes hym& whanne he has it gaes dike hym

BLHar2279.Transcription: Wende kyng Edwarde with his lange shankishaue gete Berwyke alle oure vnþankysgas pikes himand when he hath dikes him

BLHar3945.Transcription: wende king Edward wiþ his longe shankishaue ghete berwyk al oure vnthankisgas pikes himAnd whenne he haþgas dykes him

BLHar4690.Transcription: watte weneþ king Edward wiþ his longge shawnkezto wynne Berwikke alle oure vnthawnkezGoe Pike himand wanne he has itte Gaas dike him

BLHar4930.Transcription: Wenyd kyng Edward with his long shankisto haue get Barwik all our vnthankislat hym ga pike hym& when he hath it lat dyke hym

BLRoy17Dxxi.Transcription: Wende king Edwarde with his longe shankishaue goten Berewik al oure vnthankisgaz pikez himand whan he hath gaz dikez him
BLRoy17Dxxi.Note: Written as prose, underlined in red.

BLSto68.Transcription: Wende king Edward with his longe schankesto haue gete Berwyk al oure vnthankesgas pykes himand when he hath gas dikes him

BLSto70.Transcription: Wende kinge Edward wiþ his longe shankesfforto haue gete Berwyk all oure vnthankesGase dyke himAnd ofter gase dyke him

BLSto71.Transcription: Wend king Edwarde with his longe shankysto haue geten Berwyk all agayn oure thankysGas pike hym& after gas dike hym

NLWPen396D.Transcription:
Wenyst þu Edward for all þi longe shankesffor to gete
                    Barwyke aȝenst owre thankisGarre pike hym and dyke hym
NLWPen396D.Note:
In the prose Brut, rubric as heading, written as
                    verse.

HarEng530.Transcription:
Weneþe kyng Edward with hees lange shankesffor to wynne Berewyk
                    al oure vnthankesga pyke himand leet himga dyke him

HarEng587.Transcription:
Wende kynge Edwarde with his longe shankisto
                    haue grete Berewik all oure vnthankysGas pikes himAnd whanne he hath
                        doneGas dikes hym
HarEng587.Note: Written as prose; ‘done’ added by later hand.

HarEng766.Transcription:
What wenys kyng Edward with his lang shankisTo haue wonne Berwik all
                    ouer vnthankysGaas pykis hymAnd whan he hath itGaas dykis
                    hym

HarRich35.Transcription:
Wende kyng Edwarde With his lange shankesTo haue gete Berwyke Alle
                    oure vnthankesGas pyket hymAnd after þat Gas dyke
                    hym
HarRich35.Note: In prose Brut; written as verse.

YaleBei494.Transcription:
What wende king Edward wiþ his lange shankesforto geten Berwyk
                    alle oure vnþankes
YaleBei494.Note: In prose Brut; written as prose, in rubric.

HunHM131.Transcription:
Wenes king Edwarde wyth hys long shankesTo haue gete Berwyk all our
                    vnthankes
HunHM131.Note:
In prose Brut; written as prose, with virgules to mark line
                    breaks.

HunHM136.Transcription:
Wende kynge Edward wyth his longe shankesTo haue gete Berewyke all
                    our vnthankesGas pikes hymAnd when he hathGas dikes
                    hym

HunHM113.Transcription:
Wend kyng Edward with his long shankishav got berwik al our
                    vnþonkisGo pik himWhen þee hav itgo dike him
HunHM113.Note: In prose Brut; written as prose, in rubric.

TokyoTak12.Transcription:
Wende kyng Edwarde with his long shankesHaue gote Berwyke all our
                    vnthankesGas pyke him And when he has doun gas dyke him
TokyoTak12.Note: Written as three verse lines, underscored in rubric.
